gameplay
Class Dinosaur

java.lang.Object
  gameplay.Dinosaur
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Carnivorous, Herbivore
public abstract class Dinosaur
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Overview

In the game, the class Dinosaur stores information about each dinosaur of a certain player. A Dinosaur can be a Carnivorous or a Herbivore, so Dinosaur is the parent class for the Carnivorous and Herbivore classes.

Responsibilities

The class Dinosaur is responsible to store information about the dinosaurs owned by the player. A dinosaur stores information about:

  • Its species
  • Its age
  • Its maximum age
  • Its energy
  • Its size
  • Its maximum size
  • Its position in the map
  • Its ability to move
  • Its ability to grow or lay an egg
A dinosaur can be created only inside a Species, so its constructor is protected. To create a dinosaur you have to call the addDinosaur(Species theSpecies) method of the Species class.

Collaborators

A dinosaur is a class that only stores information: it cannot decide where to move or decide to move at all. All the decision are made by the Map class.

Version:
1.6
Author:
RAA
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Dinosaur

protected Dinosaur(Species theSpecies)
Parameters:
theSpecies - is the species of the dinosaur. The constructor is protected because a dinosaur can only be created inside a species, so it can be created only by a Species class.

See Also:
Food

getAge

public int getAge()
The method getAge returns the age of the dinosaur, that is the number of turns played. A dinosaur can play from 0 to ageMax turns.

Returns:
the age of the dinosaur, that is the number of turns played.

getAgeMax

public int getAgeMax()
The method getAgeMax returns the maximum age a dinosaur can live, expressed in number of turns that it can play.
After reaching that age, the dinosaur will die.

Returns:
the maximum age of the dinosaur.

getEnergy

public int getEnergy()
The method getEnergy returns the current energy of the dinosaur, that can be in the range from 0 to ageMax.
If the energy will be minor or equal to 0, the dinosaur will die.

Returns:
the current energy of the dinosaur.

getEnergyMax

public int getEnergyMax()
The method getEnergyMax returns the maximum energy that a dinosaur can store.
So if a dinosaur will eat something that should increment its energy, if it has already reached its maximum energy the energy level will remain the same.

Returns:
the maximum energy value that a dinosaur can store.

getGrowthEnergy

public int getGrowthEnergy()
The method getGrowthEnergy returns the energy needed for the dinosaur to grow up and enlarge its size by one unity.

Returns:
the energy needed for the dinosaur to grow up.

getEggDepositionEnergy

public int getEggDepositionEnergy()
The method getEggDepositionEnergy returns the amount of energy necessary to lay an egg

Returns:
1500

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
                       throws exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException
The method getId returns the DinosaurID associated to the dinosaur. A DinosaurID is associated when a dinosaur starts to play in a game. When a dinosaur leaves a game, its DinosaurID will reassigned to another dinosaur.

Returns:
the DinosaurID associated to the dinosaur
Throws:
exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException - - if the dinosaur has no DinosaurID assigned
See Also:
DinosaurIDManager

getMaxStep

public abstract int getMaxStep()
The method getMaxStep returns the the maximum distance a dinosaur can travel.

Returns:
the maximum distance a dinosaur can travel

getPosition

public util.Position getPosition()
The method getPosition returns the current position of the dinosaur in the map as a Position object.
When a dinosaur is created its position is null, that means that is not placed on the map.

Returns:
the current position of a dinosaur in the map

getSize

public int getSize()
The method getSize returns the size of the dinosaur, a number in the range from 1 to 5.

Returns:
the size of the dinosaur

getSizeMax

public int getSizeMax()
Returns:
the maximum size of the dinosaur

getSpecies

public Species getSpecies()
The method getSpecies returns the parent species of the dinosaur.
A dinosaur MUST always be assigned to a species. Otherwise a dinosaur would not exist.

Returns:
the species the dinosaur belogs to
See Also:
Species

getStrength

public abstract int getStrength()
The method getStrength returns the strength that a dinosaur can exhibit during a fight against another dinosaur.

Returns:
the strength that a dinosaur can exhibit during a fight

setAge

public void setAge(int theAge)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The method setAge sets the age of the dinosaur which is the number of turns played by the dinosaur.
The age must be a non-negative value.

Parameters:
theAge - the new age of the dinosaur
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if theAge is a negative number.

setAgeMax

protected void setAgeMax()
The method setAgeMax sets the maximum age a dinosaur can live, that is the maximum number of turns that a dinosaur can play.
There are no arguments since the maximum age is computed randomly when a dinosaur is created.

setEnergy

public void setEnergy(int theEnergy)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The method setEnergy sets the energy of the dinosaur.
The energy must be a non-negative value.

Parameters:
theEnergy - the new energy of the dinosaur
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theEnergy is a negative number.

setId

public java.lang.String setId()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
The method setId returns a string generated by DinosaurIDManager#assignIdentifierToObject(Dinosaur) which is the alphanumeric identifier of the dinosaur

Returns:
the alphanumeric string representing the dinosaur ID
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the dinosaur already has an ID assigned
See Also:
DinosaurIDManager

Position

setSize

public void setSize(int theSize)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The method setSize sets the size of the dinosaur. The size must be an integer between 1 and 5 (included).

Parameters:
theSize - is the new size of the dinosaur
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if theSize is out of range (theSize < 1 || theSize > 5)

setSizeMax

private void setSizeMax()
It sets the maximum size of the dinosaur to 5

setSpecies

private void setSpecies(Species theSpecies)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The method setSpecies sets the species of the dinosaur. You MUST assign a dinosaur to a species, since without it the dinosaur would not exist.

Parameters:
theSpecies - the species which will be assigned to the dinosaur
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the species provided is null
